results.title: The Hidden asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
The developing countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America are mainly agricultural, with 85 percent of their people living on the land. Half of all this manpower is womanpower. But so far women’s economic contributions have been largely ignored while their labour has been taken for granted. The women of Sri Lanka are attempting to change this.

results.title: The Hickory stick
results.creator_credit: National Education Association, Mental Health Film Board and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how a fifth grade teacher maintains an orderly atmosphere for learning and at the same time helps her youngsters cope with their behaviour and learning problems. Shows how she uses firmness and understanding in helping children to control their feelings and accept authority.

results.title: The Hi-Lo country
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Barbara de Fina, Martin Scorsese, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Max Evans, “The Hi-Lo Country” is a homage to the western genre. Neither revisionist nor ironically post-modern, Stephen Frears utilises much of the classic western mise-en-scene and narrative tropes to construct an entertaining old fashioned film. It is post-War America and Woody Harrelson and Billy Crudup play two friends who dream of being heroic cowboys. However, the Old West is fading and the encroachment of suburban values is chipping away at the heart of traditional mythologies. Torn between the macho behaviour they have been raised to respect and the need to understand new values and new social relationships, the differences between the two men becomes a showdown over their mutual love for the same woman. Cast also includes Penelope Cruz and Sam Elliott.

results.title: The Heroes
results.brief_description: A boy with a creative impulse is exposed to the influence of war toys through his companion and through commercialism. His conscience forces him to resist. He cannot decide what is better, reation or destruction. He eventually finds destruction more amusing than appreciation or creation, he abandons his drawing pad and runs off to play war. Music composed and sung by Glen Tomasetti.

results.title: The Hero of the Dardanelles
results.brief_description: Made as a patriotic recruiting film, endorsed and assisted by the Department of Defence. This is the story of the careers of two brothers, one who has already enlisted in the Army and another, William, who soon follows his example. The film shows Will being trained and while on his final leave, persuading his pal to enlist. His patriotism and enthusiasm for the war is simple and unquestioning, and he is the pride of his wealthy family and sweetheart. They hold a banquet in his honour and he is clearly established as an upperclass hero who will doubtless be good officer material in the Army. Once his boat leaves for Egypt, the progress of his story is unknown, for the remainder of the film is no longer in existence. Cast, Fred Francis, Guy Hastings, Loma Rossmore, C. Throoby, Ruth Wainwright.

results.title: The Hero as an artist; Protest and communication
results.creator_credit: BBC, Michael Gill and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 5 and 6 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 5. Michelangelo, Raphael and Leonardo da Vinci are featured in this program which centres on Papal Rome in the early 16th century. Sir Kenneth Clarke’s theme takes him through the gardens and courtyards of the Vatican to the rooms decorated for the Pope by Raphael and to the Sistine Chapel. Part 6. The theme of protest and communication leads Sir Kenneth to the Reformation, the Germany of Albrecht Durer and Martin Luther, to Erasmus, the France of Montaigne and to the Elizabethan England of Shakespeare.

results.title: The Hermitage: art treasures tour (PC)
results.brief_description: This interactive CD-ROM takes the viewer on a tour of the State Hermitage Museum, St Petersburg, Russia. The museum was built during the 18th century to house the private art collection of the Tsars, today it houses more than 3,000,000 artefacts from Prehistory to Modern Day. You can take your pick of video clips about Rembrandt, French, Roman and Italian Art; look at music and the arts, in particular Rachmaninoff and Tchaikovsky; take guided tours of Russian, Western European and Oriental Art, the Golden Chamber, architecture, art of classical antiquity; as well as looking through maps and essays written by museum experts.

results.title: The Heritage of the uncommon man
results.creator_credit: BNA Communications and Reid H Ray
results.brief_description: Joe Powell, a noted lecturer to businessmen, expounds his notions of the “Uncommon man” - the man who gets results. In an entertaining lecture, Powell describes the attributes and behaviour of the successful executive. Uses cartoons to illustrate some points of the lecture.

results.title: The Herd
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Starr and Peter Lynch
results.brief_description: In 1929, 62 year old Andy Bahr completed a 2,400 kilometre journey across the hostile and unmapped terrain of Alaska. What was remarkable about the journey that he completed with a team of Inuit and Sami herders, was that they herded 3,000 reindeer along the way. The Canadian government, in a well intentioned move to provide a livelihood for the Mackenzie Delta Inuit, had purchased the herd, which now required transportation. The drive was expected to take 18 months; it lasted 6 years. Filmed on location from the Bering Strait in Alaska to the Beaufort Sea in the Northwest Territories, this stunning odyssey combines historical documentation, epic myth and irreverent humour to follow Bahr’s quest to the edge of the world.

results.title: The Herald newsreel
results.brief_description: One of the first sound films produced in Australia, this newsreel shows Joe Lyons, Prime Minister 1931-1939, and his Cabinet giving a message for Britain and the sister dominions, after swearing in at Government House. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
